configuration.name: mc-item-022398373670876026
configuration.title: Unit Starter: Observing Differences in Scale
configuration.stem: When you view a living organism with a microscope, you can see cells and their structures, which are not visible to your unaided eye. These images show a cat's hair at three different magnifications: at actual size (1x), at 100 times larger than actual size, and at 400 times larger than actual size. Compare how the appearance changes at different magnifications.

options.name: mc-opt-item-028151441155932844
options.label: 1x
options.imageAlt: This unmagnified photograph shows a cat crouched in the grass. It shows that the cat has tortoiseshell coloring, but individual hairs on the catâ€™s body are not visible.

options.name: mc-opt-item-06761015402153134x1
options.label: 100x
options.imageAlt: This photograph shows several individual cat hairs at one hundred times their actual size. Each hair appears about the size of a pencil. Some of the hairs are mottled brown, and some are black.

options.name: LII-06931107316635485
options.label: 400x
options.imageAlt: This photograph from an electron microscope shows a few individual cat hairs at four hundred times their actual size. The hairs have a rough, scaly texture. The hairs appear grayish blue because the electron microscope image does not show the color of the hairs.
